senses.de: To depend on something or someone for support or help
senses.ex: You can always rely on her to keep a secret

Tips.title: Emotional Bond
Tips.description: Implying trust in someone else's abilities or character, often in a personal context.
Tips.example: I rely on my brother for advice.

Tips.title: Implied Necessity
Tips.description: Suggests a strong need for the support that's being relied upon.
Tips.example: Small businesses rely on loyal customers.

Tips.title: Consistency Expected
Tips.description: Often used when there’s an expectation of consistent help or support.
Tips.example: He relies on his routine to stay organized.

senses.de: To feel sure that something will happen or somebody will do as expected
senses.ex: She's relying on getting a raise to afford the new house

Tips.title: Future Expectation
Tips.description: Used when someone is confident that an event or action will happen.
Tips.example: I rely on the bus being on time.

Tips.title: No Backup Plan
Tips.description: Indicates no alternative is considered; may imply risk.
Tips.example: She solely relies on her scholarship for tuition.

senses.de: To trust in a law or principle
senses.ex: The prosecutor relied on evidence from the crime scene

Tips.title: Legal Confidence
Tips.description: In law, expresses trust in the strength or relevance of legal elements.
Tips.example: Lawyers rely on robust evidence to win cases.

Tips.title: Technical Use
Tips.description: Highlights a formal context where precise language is key.
Tips.example: Judges rely on legal precedent to make rulings.

senses.de: To use as a basis or foundation for; to base something on
senses.ex: The study relies on data from various sources

Tips.title: Foundation of Truth
Tips.description: Indicates reliance on empirical or proven information.

Tips.title: Academic Rigor
Tips.description: Used to reflect thorough research and credibility in academic work.
Tips.example: His thesis relies on extensive fieldwork.

Bank on.wordDefinition:
The main difference between bank on and rely is that bank on is used to express a higher level of certainty than "rely." When you say that you bank on something, you are saying that you are completely counting on it to happen or be true.

On the other hand, when you say that you rely on something, it means that you are depending on it, but you are not necessarily 100% certain that it will always work out.

For example, if you say "I'm banking on getting an A on this test," you are expressing complete certainty that you will get an A.

If you say "I rely on my alarm clock to wake me up in the mornings," you are saying that you need your alarm clock to work, but you acknowledge that there is a chance it might not always work perfectly.

Bank on is used for situations where you need to express complete confidence in something, while rely is used when you are depending on something, but you are acknowledging that there is some uncertainty involved.

Believe in.wordDefinition:
Believe in means to have faith or trust in something or someone, to accept that it exists or is true without necessarily having any evidence or proof.

It is often used in a more abstract or emotional sense, such as believing in oneself, believing in a higher power, or believing in a cause.

Rely means to depend on something or someone for support, help, or assistance. It implies that there is a tangible need or expectation for something to be provided, and that without it, there could be negative consequences.

Believe in is more related to personal values and beliefs, while rely is more related to practical needs and expectations.

Confide in.wordDefinition:
The words confide in and rely both have to do with trust, but they are used in different contexts.

Confide in means to trust someone with personal information or a secret. For example, you might confide in your best friend about a problem you're having.

It's a more emotional connection based on sharing feelings and personal experiences.

Rely means to depend on someone or something for help or support. For example, you might rely on your parents to provide for you or a teacher to help you understand a difficult subject.

It's a more practical connection based on needing assistance or resources.

You would use confide in when you want to share personal information with someone you trust, and rely when you need to depend on someone or something for help or support.

Count on.wordDefinition:
Both count on and rely mean to depend on someone or something for support, help, or assistance.

Count on is used when you expect someone or something to do what you need them to do. For example, you can count on your best friend to always be there for you when you need them.

Rely is used when you greatly trust someone or something to perform a task or function correctly. For example, you rely on your car to safely take you from one place to another.

Overall, both words have similar meanings and can be used interchangeably, but count on implies expectation while rely suggests greater trust and dependence.

Depend.wordDefinition:
Depend means to need someone or something in order to survive or function properly. For example, you might depend on your parents to provide you with food, shelter, and clothes.

Both words are similar in meaning, but depend is more about needing something to survive, while rely is more about trusting something to be there when you need it.

Lean on.wordDefinition:
Lean on means to physically lean or rest on something for support or guidance, while rely means to depend or trust in someone or something for help or support, usually in a non-physical way.

For example, you can lean on a wall for support, but you rely on your parents for help and guidance in life. Lean on is more applicable in physical situations where support is needed, while rely is used more in emotional or mental situations where trust and dependability are important.

Rest on.wordDefinition:
The words rely and rest on mean that you are counting on something or someone for support or help.

However, rely is more commonly used when it comes to people or things that are reliable and trustworthy. For example, you might say "I rely on my best friend to always be there for me.".

Rest on is often used when you are talking about things that are more uncertain or risky. It suggests that you are placing your hope or trust in something that may or may not come through for you.

For example, you might say "my chances of getting into college rest on how well I do on my SATs."

Rely is used when you have faith in something or someone's abilities to deliver, while rest on is used when you are hoping for the best but aren't entirely sure of the outcome.

Trust.wordDefinition:
Trust means to have confidence in someone or something, especially that they will act honestly, with your best interests in mind, and in line with your expectations.

For example, if you trust your best friend, you believe that they will keep your secrets, be loyal to you, and support you in difficult times.

In summary, relying is when you depend on something or someone to perform a task, while trusting is when you have confidence in someone or something to act not only as required, but also in line with your expectations.

quotes.Text: Poor people cannot rely on the government to come to help you in times of need. You have to get your education. Then nobody can control your destiny.
quotes.Title: American Baseball Player
quotes.Name: Charles Barkley

quotes.Text: You cannot rely on the police, you cannot rely on the government, you cannot rely on the bank to protect you.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Frank Abagnale

quotes.Text: Neither should a ship rely on one small anchor, nor should life rest on a single hope.
quotes.Title: Greek Philosopher
quotes.Name: Epictetus

quotes.Text: Advertisements contain the only truths to be relied on in a newspaper.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.Text: It's so important your customer can rely on you for your classics.
quotes.Title: American Designer
quotes.Name: L'Wren Scott

quotes.Text: It's important for the team not to be relying on one player.
quotes.Title: Uruguayan Athlete
quotes.Name: Luis Suarez

quotes.Text: The fight for democracy relies on community support.
quotes.Title: Chinese Activist
quotes.Name: Joshua Wong

quotes.Text: We live in a world that relies on technology.
quotes.Title: Australian Producer
quotes.Name: James Wan

quotes.Text: Luck relies on chance, labor on character.
quotes.Title: British Businessman
quotes.Name: Richard Cobden

quotes.Text: You cannot rely on other people's support.
quotes.Title: Pakistani Activist
quotes.Name: Malala Yousafzai
